dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...really, like, not even breaking a sweat. Reed Hastings, you know, Netflix CEO, he's just, uh, casually stating this is gonna be minimal disruption from all these new entrants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...really, like, not even breaking a sweat. Reed Hastings, you know, Netflix C E O, he's just, uh, casually stating this is gonna be minimal disruption from all these new entrants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Minimal disruption? Come on. His stock dropped five bucks after hours, B. That's, like, not 'minimal' if you're a shareholder.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Minimal disruption? Come on. His stock dropped five bucks after hours, B. That's, like, not 'minimal' if you're a shareholder.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but hold on. That drop was, uh, mainly because they forecast slower growth, not current performance. The Q1 numbers? They added 9.6 million subscribers, which is a record. Nine point six! Mostly outside the US, mind you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but hold on. That drop was, uh, mainly because they forecast slower growth, not current performance. The Q1 numbers? They added nine point six million subscribers, which is a record. Nine point six! Mostly outside the U S, mind you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March. Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S. The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but they also cancelled Jessica Jones, and, like, their US rate hike is apparently 'moderating growth.' Doesn't exactly scream confidence, does it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but they also cancelled Jessica Jones, and, like, their U S rate hike is apparently 'moderating growth.' Doesn't exactly scream confidence, does it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This guidance takes into account the impact Netflix's rate increase in the U.S., which is moderating growth in the spring quarter, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But that's just the US. He's saying the global shift from linear to on-demand is so massive there's just ample room for everyone. He's not wrong, A. Think about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's just the U S. He's saying the global shift from linear to on-demand is so massive there's just ample room for everyone. He's not wrong, A. Think about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Ample appetite for what? How many streaming services can people actually afford or even want to juggle?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ample appetite for what? How many streaming services can people actually afford or even want to juggle?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he says Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand. And they're aiming to capture fifteen percent of the global entertainment market by 2024. They're at, like, ten percent of total TV usage in the US now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he says Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand. And they're aiming to capture fifteen percent of the global entertainment market by twenty twenty four. They're at, like, ten percent of total T V usage in the U S now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He argued that theres ample appetite for great movies and TV shows, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand. Netflix represents only about 10% of total TV usage in the U.S., its most mature market, Hastings noted...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Still. Disney+ is coming with Star Wars and Marvel. Apple's got theirs. It's getting crowded. He's got to be sweating a little.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still. Disney+ is coming with Star Wars and Marvel. Apple's got theirs. It's getting crowded. He's got to be sweating a little.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The forthcoming service debuts in the U.S. on Nov. 12 with a strong roster of entertainment brands, including Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: He says he doubts it will be material. Plus, look at their original content. Umbrella Academy? Forty-five million households watched that in the first month. Triple Frontier? Fifty-two million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He says he doubts it will be material. Plus, look at their original content. Umbrella Academy? Forty-five million households watched that in the first month. Triple Frontier? Fifty-two million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said. Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: So they made some successful shows. So what? Doesn't change the fact that everyone else is jumping into the pool.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they made some successful shows. So what? Doesn't change the fact that everyone else is jumping into the pool.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: No, but their strategy of local content is huge. Nailed It! México got three times more first-month viewers than the dubbed US version. And Kingdom, their Korean zombie show, is a massive hit in Korea and internationally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but their strategy of local content is huge. Nailed It! México got three times more first-month viewers than the dubbed U S version. And Kingdom, their Korean zombie show, is a massive hit in Korea and internationally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ¡Nailed It!: México has achieved three times more first-month watchers in Mexico than the dubbed US version, Hastings said. The service also premiered it first large scale Korean original series, Kingdom , in January. This period piece with zombies is our most successful season one show in Korea to date and has also been watched by millions of members outside of Korea, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: A Korean zombie show, huh? Okay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A Korean zombie show, huh? Okay.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It's about exclusive, global stories. That's what Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos says. The top ten shows are all Netflix original brands, um, increasingly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's about exclusive, global stories. That's what Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos says. The top ten shows are all Netflix original brands, um, increasingly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos. So increasingly our business is about creating and telling great stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, okay. We'll see how long that lasts when all the Marvel stuff leaves for Disney+, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, okay. We'll see how long that lasts when all the Marvel stuff leaves for Disney+, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: He's just saying there's more room to grow around the world. It's a massive shift, A. It really is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's just saying there's more room to grow around the world. It's a massive shift, A. It really is.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix represents only about 10% of total TV usage in the U.S., its most mature market, Hastings noted, and there's more room to grow around the world.
